alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; De Baca County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 9:19PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL DE BACA AND NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM MDT... At 918 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles northwest of Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge, or 19 miles north of Roswell, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa. This includes Highway 285 between Mile Markers 122 and 153. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; De Baca County
